bibl.title: Regional Texts and the Circulation of Books: The Case of Homer.
bibl.note: An attempt at contextualization of the transmission of Homer's text in the Hellenistic, Roman and Byzantine periods. Until the emergence of Constantinople, the production, circulation, and transmission of books concentrated around regional centres. Alexandria was only one such centre among others.
bibl.seg: FINKELBERG Margalit, Regional Texts and the Circulation of Books: The Case of Homer.

An attempt at contextualization of the transmission of Homer's text in the Hellenistic, Roman and Byzantine periods. Until the emergence of Constantinople, the production, circulation, and transmission of books concentrated around regional centres. Alexandria was only one such centre among others.
